002package com.commercetools.docs.meta;
003
004/**
005 * <h2>Querying the API</h2>
006 *
007 * <h3>Predicates</h3>
008 *
009 * <p>The platform allows the use of <a href="https://docs.commercetools.com/api/predicates/query">predicates</a> when
010 * querying the API. Predicates are added as query parameter string to the request itself. The following example shows
011 * the usage of <a href="https://docs.commercetools.com/api/predicates/query#input-variable-examples">input variables</a></p>
012 *
013 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#queryPredicateVariable()}
014 *
015 * It's also possible to use array values in predicates in case of a varying number of parameters
016 *
017 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#queryPredicateVariableArray()}
018 *
019 * <h3>Get by id/key</h3>
020 *
021 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#getByIdOrKey()}
022 *
023 * <h3>Query all</h3>
024 *
025 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#queryAll()}
026 *
027 * <h3>Sorting</h3>
028 *
029 * <p>Please see <a href="https://docs.commercetools.com/api/general-concepts#sorting">Sort</a> for details</p>
030 *
031 * <p>Sorting using one parameter:</p>
032 *
033 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#simpleSort()}
034 *
035 * <p>Sorting using multiple parameters:</p>
036 *
037 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#multiSort()}
038 *
039 * <h3 id=pagination>Pagination</h3>
040 *
041 * <p>Limiting the number of the returned documents or page size:</p>
042 *
043 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#limitPagination()}
044 *
045 * <p>To retrieve the next results use the offset parameter. The example shows how to retrieve page 2:</p>
046 *
047 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#limitOffsetPagination()}
048 */
049public class Querying {
050}
